quote: I use AI for things that allow me to gather information or find out what I can visit in a given country.
I plan what I can visit in a given country on a given day so that I don't have to travel from one end of the city to the other.
It's best to move around a given city using the metro, public transport such as trams, buses, or trains.
I know that AI is constantly learning and you have to use it wisely because not all information is verified.
It would be best if it showed verified information, not fake, Linux.
That in the future it could help in everyday life but not replace face-to-face contact.
I'm not sure if I need to see a specialist immediately for a specific illness or if I can wait for an appointment.
With the calendar, it could remind me of things I have noted there.
Coffee machine, refrigerator that would inform me that something has run out.
AI still doesn't fully express itself correctly in a given language, so I preferred to contact a person from this side.
Grammatical problems and face-to-face conversations cannot be replaced by artificial intelligence.
In interaction with AI, if I talk face to face, I see how the person reacts to the questions asked, how they answer, what their facial expressions are.
